page.title: 07HUTTON ESTATE - WILDLIFE
page.content:
{MAMMALS} It is estimated that there are 6 badger setts, and 20 fox earths, as well as considerable numbers of smaller animals, such as hares and rabbits. Of particular interest are red squirrels (no grey), and a number of colonies of bats. A recent, unwelcome, immigrant is the mink.
{BIRDS} Because of the wide variety of habitats, there is considerable diversity of bird species, although Red Shank and Barn Owls have disappeared from New Rent Area. Recently buzzards have been showing an increase, while there has been a decline in stream residing birds, because of pollution.
